wikitext.*:
'''''lhach''''' is an [[Elvish]] element meaning "leaping flame".<ref name=S>{{S|Appendix}}</ref>

The word is commonly understood to be a [[Sindarin]] word, taking the [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Sindarin]] form ''lach''.<ref>[[Didier Willis]], [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/english.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/haut.shtml Jrrvf.com] (accessed 19 July 2011)</ref><ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 322</ref><ref>[http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth] at [http://www.tolkiendil.com Tolkiendil.com] (accessed 19 July 2011)</ref>

==Examples==

*''[[Dagor Bragollach]]''<ref name=S/>
*''[[Anglachel#Etymology|Anglachel]]''<ref name=S/>

Other possible examples are ''[[Amlach]]'' and ''[[Borlach]]''.

==See also==
*''[[lacho]]'' ("flame")
